snippet: The rise in sentiment came despite higher gasoline prices, and was the latest indication that economic growth was regaining momentum.
abstract: Survey finds American consumers are feeling more confident, with University of Michigan's consumer sentiment index rising to 94.6 in early June from 90.7 in May; Labor Dept also reports increase of 0.5 percent in May in Producer Price Index for final demand.
lead_paragraph: The rise in sentiment came despite higher gasoline prices, and was the latest indication that economic growth was regaining momentum.

headline.main: Survey Shows Sharp Jump in Consumer Confidence
headline.print_headline: Consumer Confidence in U.S. Rose in June
